required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 27, 2015
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: ANSeR- The Algorithm for Neonatal Seizure Recognition Study
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicentre Clinical Evaluation of a Decision Support Algorithm for Neonatal Seizure Detection

brief_summary.textblock: A Multicentre Clinical Evaluation of a Decision Support Algorithm for Neonatal Seizure Detection: ANSeR

detailed_description.textblock: This is a multi-centre study. It will be based on routine clinical practice but will also allow for the off-line retrospective application of ANSeR to a well-defined clinical population in order to establish the potential diagnostic utility of the algorithm.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: To quantify the overall diagnostic accuracy of the Algorithm.
primary_outcome.description: To measure diagnostic accuracy of ANSeR (Algorithm) and clinicians (in routine clinical practice or optimised clinical practice) during the initial up to but not limited to 72 hour period of post-natal EEG monitoring, using an expert panel as the reference standard.

secondary_outcome.measure: Inappropriate use/non-use of Anti Epileptic Drugs (AEDs)
secondary_outcome.description: To quantify the degree and duration of inappropriate use/non-use of AEDs with the off-line application of the ANSeR algorithm and routine clinical practice. To compare (a) and (b).

secondary_outcome.measure: To examine factors that influence diagnostic accuracy in clinical practice.
secondary_outcome.description: To examine factors that influence diagnostic accuracy in clinical practice.

arm_group.description: Term neonates who are undergoing continuous video amplified Electroencephalogram (aEEG)/Electroencephalogram (EEG) monitoring for clinical purposes (e.g. because seizures were suspected, or the neonate is being treated with therapeutic hypothermia). EEGs will be analysed off line by 'Algorithm for Neonatal Seizure Recognition'

intervention.description: Software system for neonatal seizure detection recognition

study_pop.textblock: Term neonates who are undergoing continuous video aEEG/EEG monitoring for clinical purposes (e.g. because seizures were suspected, or the neonate is being treated with therapeutic hypothermia)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
All term neonates at risk of seizures are eligible for the ANSeR study.
Neonates â‰¥ 36 weeks gestation will be recruited if:
They have a need for EEG monitoring.
Exclusion Criteria:
Consent of parents not obtained.

facility.name: University Medical Centre Utrecht, Wilhelmina Children's Hospital
University College London Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
